text: let me tell you about Bitcoin when 2017
started Bitcoin was trading just below
$1,000 up from the usual 6 to 700 range
first came the dodgy types like the
Italian mafia who were reportedly using
crypto currencies to launder dirty cash
and then we were told North Korea was
hacking Bitcoin exchanges to start
sanctions then initial coin offerings or
icos were introduced they're really just
like public share offerings but with
crypto currencies except nobody gets any
shares or any real profits for that
matter still businesses rushed in and
just as quickly there was a backlash by
this time everyone from your friendly
neighborhood uber driver to the world's
biggest bankers had an opinion on
Bitcoin JP Morgan's Jamie Dimon said
Bitcoin was a fraud Warren Buffett
called the whole thing a joke and
Goldman Sachs CEO Lloyd Blankfein well
he can't seem to make up his mind he
doesn't like it he's not guessing but
this will work out but hey if it does
Goldman's is ready they got on board
meanwhile Vietnam banned virtual
currencies Russia China and India
essentially said yet to Bitcoin and
almost everyone else has sent varying
messages of caution and skepticism but
there are a few cheerleaders like
Venezuela for instance whose own
currency is doing so badly that it
thought hey crypto currencies can't be
worse by n November bitcoins value had
grown ten times from the start of the
year and then less than two weeks later
it almost doubled again before the year
without Bitcoin futures were launched on
two of America's biggest derivatives
exchanges no less so fraud or no fraud
you can't ignore it now
